title: Why I think Morde's got such a low win rate currently
body:
I'm currently on my climb to platinum using Mordekaiser whenever I can, which is almost 100%, and am rocking a 61% win rate with the metal man.
I never feel he's trash and actually think he's criminally underrated for what he can bring to the table but I'm digressing.

Looking over his statistics at Champion.gg made me raise an eyebrow at all these odd things I was seeing.
The two things that bothered me the most were the choice of core build and starting items, two things that I deem essential for Mordekaiser's success.

**Core Build**
Morde's core build with a stunning win rate of 47% consists of a Rylais into Zhonyas only to be followed by some tanky options.
Rylais is core but sadly this is where the build goes south, getting a Zhonyas after Rylais makes Mordekaiser way too squishy to actually do anything come mid game.
The build's not bad per se but the ORDER is completely off and makes Mordekaiser's performance fall short.

**Starters**
{{item:1054}} and {{item:2003}} 

Dorans and pot...

This might just be the worst starter, even worse than Dorans ring.
Mordekaiser needs to sustain himself in the laning phase but doran's simply doesn't cut it.
Getting Cloth to deal with heavy ad harass or boots to escape ganks is such a better option and helps cover up some of Mordekaiser's early game problems while getting a Shield doesn't help as much

**3. Lack of Mordekaiser mains in plat+**
Champion.gg only includes stats from platinum and above and as far as I know high elo lacks serious Mordekaiser mains who dedicate enough time to learn the ins and outs of League's Iron Man.
A lack of experience and proper champion mastery might just be the biggest factor for Mordekaiser having such an abysmally low win rate currently.

This is just something that bothers me greatly, seeing that Morde's slowly becoming a real Joke and the lobbies who flame me for picking Mordekaiser get more common by the day.

In the end I think Mordekaiser's win rate doesn't reflect his power level as it currently stands and might even lead riot to do something rash and result in Mordekaiser becoming way too strong and get trashed in the process.

Honestly, my impression from morde is that his winrate reflects his power quite well at high elo(well ok, he's certainly better than 45%, but still not in the best spot).
Once jungler and laner work somewhat well together, toplane becomes a dangerous place for morde. He has the least mobillity one can have, he has no cc, and early on he's fairly squishy.
And even if he survives lane, the pay off isn't really there. Once you opponents are decent at chaining cc and focusing a target, you can't affort to built squishy. You need rylais into 2-4 straight tank items to do anything in a teamfight, and that causes your damage to fall flat, as you rarly will make you way past the frontline, and you lack the magic-pen to really do that much to the frontline. And often enough, you will just eat some CC and everyone will get out of range as soon as your 3ed Q is ready, and 2sec later when it's expired you just get ignored once again.
Not even the ult is much of a saveing grace, as carries will get QSS as 3ed item. If he somehow manages to get a carryghost or a dragon ghost after a won fight, then chances are good that he will take alot objectives and snowball from there. But if that doesn't happen, he's pretty weak vs good opponents.

The only exeption to that i have seen so far is a morde with good suport, like a midlane lulu, as that allows him to built more agressive and still become a die hard while also beeing way harder to kite with the speedbuff.
Though lulu is a beast in many combinations, a darius or garen with lulu sup is just as scarry, and fnatic showed today how powerfull an adc with lulu can be...

In the interest of not just adding to the bad winrate what are you supposed to build on morde? I havent touched him since S3 and well life was simple back then.

I usually altenate between offensive Items and defensive ones. I always start with Rylai, and I think everyone herewill agree that there is no better first item on him. Then Deadman's Plate, because, since I max Q first, the damage will stay relevant a long time, even with only one damage item. Then, I build Hextech Gunblade, because it is the item that gives Mordekaiser the most damage in the game. Then I build the Spiritual Visage, for RM and sustain. The last item depend on what my opponent are, but I usually want an item that gives both survivabily and Damage, like Liandry's Torment, Sterak's Gage, Zhonya's Hourglass or Abyssal Scepter. There are four possibles boots for Mordekaiser : Sorcerer's Shoes, Ionian Boots of Lucidity, Boots of Celerity, Mercury's Threads.

It's somewhat surprising that no pro teams have taken him for a spin. Consider that dragons are basically free in the professional game now - teams simply don't value to buffs enough to risk fighting over them. Instead they focus on pushing tower objectives and punishing teams that take time out of lane for worthless dragon buffs. Except then there's Morde. Free dragons = free tower pushing power to a ridiculous degree. If you play a comp that allows you free reign on the dragon you'll basically win bot lane outright unless you completely screw up. It would be cool to see some team take a chance and try to abuse this lack of dragon control by using a champ that can really make use of it.
